description:
Today we are working, socialising, learning, entertaining ourselves and much, much more behind screens, and as such it’s never been more critical that we prioritise our physical, mental and emotional wellbeing.

This talk from Emma Robertson, co-founder of Digital Awareness UK, will provide expert advice on how you can better manage everything from digital eye strain to posture wellness to digital parenting.

Whether you’re an employer seeking to ensure your workforce are healthy, happy and productive when working remotely – or an employee hoping to optimise your physical and digital working environment – this talk will leave you feeling inspired to improve your tech habits, throughout this pandemic and beyond.

SPEAKER
Emma Robertson
Digital Awareness UK
Founder and CEO

Emma Robertson is the award-winning Co-Founder of leading digital wellbeing organisation Digital Awareness UK, which delivers community impact and employee engagement solutions to schools and organisations around the world.

Whether she’s working with the United Nations to empower refugees living across Africa or schools in the UK seeking to push the digital wellbeing agenda amongst students, she has a wealth of experience and research findings to share around ensuring we can all survive and thrive online.

Emma can regularly be seen on the news campaigning for more action to be taken to help us use technology safely and responsibly.

title: Digital Wellbeing @ Work: Avoiding Tech Burnout
